Description: Join us for an enlightening session on the promise of adaptive immune receptor repertoire (AIRR) profiling to yield novel, reproducible insights into individuals' immune responses. While the method has presented numerous challenges, speakers from Indiana University and Cellecta will delve into how they have used this technique to obtain a greater understanding of patients' adaptive immune responses in squamous carcinoma and other diseases. They’ll share data generated using the DriverMap AIR assay, a multiplex-RT-PCR and NGS-based assay, highlighting its utility and promise. Don’t miss this opportunity to learn the state of the art in adaptive immune profiling!
Location: Spotlight Theater B - Sails Pavilion - Conv Ctr
SearchResultBody: ESP8B. Adaptive Immune Receptor Profiling for Promising Insights into Potential Therapeutic and Biomarker Targets

Title: Adaptive Immune Receptor Profiling for Promising Insights into Potential Therapeutic and Biomarker Targets
